BookData.Title: After a Stroke
BookData.TitleLong: After a Stroke: 300 Tips for Making Life Easier
BookData.Summary: Covers the home-recovery process after a stroke -- and no subject is off-limits. Readers will learn how to progress from patient to person again. The author shares 300+ tips she learned and used during her recovery, including information about communication, emotional liability, safety issues, rest periods, dressing, personal care, cooking, home maintenance, housekeeping skills, traveling, relaxation techniques, and sex.

BookData.Title: After welfare
BookData.TitleLong: After welfare: the culture of postindustrial social policy
BookData.PublisherText: New York : New York University Press, c2000.
BookData.Notes:
Includes bibliographical references (p. 185-228) and index.
Contracting America : the cycle of representation and the contagion of policy discourse -- Where the welfare queen resides : the subtext of personal responsibility -- In the clinic : the medicalization of welfare -- Deconstructing devolution : racing to the bottom and other ironies of welfare reform -- Redefining the family, redefining the state : the politics of incorporation and the case of same-sex marriage -- A new space for welfare policy research : benefit decline on the internet -- After social security : searching for a postindustrial ethic.

BookData.Title: Ageing and later life
BookData.AuthorsText: edited by Julia Johnson and Robert Slater
BookData.PublisherText: London ; Sage Publications in association with The Open University, 1993.
BookData.Notes:
Includes bibliographical references and indexes.
Personal Accounts -- 1.Look me in the eye /Barbara Macdonald -- 2.Coming out of the age closet /Maxine Myers -- 3.ageing of Mary Berenson /Bill Bytheway -- 4.Home from home? /Evan Marsh -- 5.Mrs Hatter /Janet Ford and Ruth Sinclair -- 6.Mr and Mrs Cosgrove /Jeremy Seabrook -- 7.Epilogue to An Autobiography /Agatha Christie -- Images and identity -- 8.Old age in crime fiction /Mike Hepworth -- 9.cream cracker under the settee /Alan Bennett -- 10.Have the men had enough? /Margaret Forster -- 11.photographic image /Kathleen Woodward -- 12.Ageing with a disability /Gerry Zarb -- 13.Ageing and cultural stereotypes of older women /Jay Ginn and Sara Arber -- 14.Ageing and ethnicity /Ken Blakemore -- Ill-Health and Well-Being -- 15.health of older Asians /Liam Donaldson and Marie Johnson -- 16.Osteoporosis in women /Jean Shapiro -- 17.Depression in later life /Elaine Murphy -- 18.Frames of reference for an understanding of dementia /Tom Kitwood -- 19.Love, sex and aging /Edward M. Brecher -- 20.Age discrimination in health care /Melanie Henwood -- Intervention and Therapy -- 21.Does group living work? /Julia Johnson -- 22.holistic approach in the ward /Helen Passant -- 23.Elderly people: their medicines and their doctors /Drug and Therapeutics Bulletin -- 24.Assessing risk /Alison Norman -- 25.Vulnerable to abuse /Olive Stevenson -- 26.Baffle locks: in whose best interest? /Grainne Sheridan -- 27.Freedom to wander /Peter Blackburn -- Power and Control -- 28.Obstacles to the development of user-centred services /Tim Booth -- 29.Rest assured: new moves in quality assurance for residential care /Leonie Kellaher and Sheila Peace -- 30.powerhouse for change: empowering users /Phyllida Parsloe and Olive Stevenson -- 31.Approaches to advocacy /Chris Phillipson -- 32.pensioners' movement: federation, consolidation, fragmentation, 1938-1948 /Andrew Blaikie -- 33.On being a woman in the pensioners' movement /Zelda Curtis -- Concepts and Values -- 34.Ageism: concept and definition /Julia Johnson and Bill Bytheway -- 35.'Us' and 'them'? Feminist research, community care and disability /Jenny Morris -- 36.Philosophical perspectives on quality of life /Andrew Sixsmith -- 37.Religion and aging /David O. Moberg -- 38.Gerontological approaches to quality of life /Beverley Hughes -- 39.Measuring quality of life /Michael Bury and Anthea Holme -- Policy and Politics -- 40.Ideology and the private sector of welfare /Roy Parker -- 41.Housing and community care /Robin Means -- 42.Workers versus pensioners /Paul Johnson, Christoph Conrad and David Thompson -- 43.new prospects for retirement /Michael Young and Tom Schuller -- 44.Older people in Europe: social and economic policies /Alan Walker and Jens Alber -- Pasts -- 45.Born 1898; a brief group biography /Mark Abrams -- 46.Oral history as a social movement: reminiscence and older people /Joanna Bornat -- 47.History of migration to the United Kingdom /John Young and James George -- 48.Glimpses of a lost history /Paul Thompson -- 49.Social services for elderly people: from Beveridge to Thatcher /Robin Means -- 50.historical development of geriatric medicine as a specialty /Helen Evers -- 51.History of old age in western culture and society /Georges Minois -- Futures -- 52.politics of age /Russell A. Grigsby -- 55.Can we survive the world revolution? /Alexander King and Bertrand Schneider.

T. Walls -- Full circling / Elaine Lee -- In the heat of shadow / Jewelle Gomez -- Parents, wives, and womanhood : the lessons we never learned / Ta'shia Asanti Karade -- Age and sexuality / Maya Angelou -- Trust me / Pearl Cleage -- Gray pussy hair / Opal Palmer Adisa -- Safer sex (before and) after fifty / Gale Madyun -- Plum jelly in hot shiny jars / Akasha Gloria Hull -- It might as well be spring / Carleen Brice -- The company she keeps / Colleen McElroy -- From do-it-yourself rainbows / J.
